website_summaries.verdict: A unique weeding tool with a decent price, although it may be more effective in certain types of soil, such as sand or clay.
pros: Head is curved and forked for effectiveness, and it is resistant to rust
Handle is large and easy on the hand and wrist
Gives decent leverage for most users
cons: A few buyers were less than satisfied with the effectiveness of the design

customer_reviews.title: It also bends too easily and the edges could be sharper
customer_reviews.text: 2 because the tips broke off. It also bends too easily and the edges could be sharper. Other than that, the design is ergonomic and really works to get weeds by the roots and in close spaces. I was disappointed to finally find a seeder that a) works and b) is somewhat comfortable and then it snapped...both tips!
customer_reviews.author: City Dweller

customer_reviews.title: Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: A helpful, handy-dandy tool to get to the, especially deep rooted, weeds out of the ground. The forked end grabs and cuts into the root, and the seat provides extra help to push the whole weed out of the ground in one piece to eliminate regrowth. If the soil around the weed is hardened, spraying it beforehand helps to get to the undergrowth and to pull the offending weed out in one piece. Or crack the surface with a hoe. Happy gardening! The best kind of exercise a wo/man may want or need.
customer_reviews.author: Xanadu

customer_reviews.title: Design problems
customer_reviews.text: This design does not work for me. The jog in the shaft that is there to give leverage limits how deeply I can stab into the soil to a couple inches. That is enough for shallow weeds, but makes this a really poor tool for dandelions or anything with a deep taproot. Also, the forked tip has a very narrow gap. As a result, wood chips, debris, or even just impacted dirt kept clogging the fork and needing to be cleared out.
customer_reviews.author: ymr049c

customer_reviews.title: good & bad
customer_reviews.text: It's OK. Me - love the handle, nice feel. Somewhat ergonomic. Cover for the tip. Hubby likes it. All great for me until...darn. The tip is sharp BUT the tines are very short. They are placed way too close together. I have to get exactly under the dandelion root - and who know where that is sometimes? If you are attacking shallow root weeds where you can see the base it is perfect. If you're going for long roots like dandelions you might want something with long, wide tines to pop it out. (I have bad wrists and wanted to like this)
customer_reviews.author: SashaSS

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, no rust
customer_reviews.text: Ok! I'm pretty happy with this weed puller after years of use. I was concerned the aluminum head / shank would dull, but I purposely avoid using this tool to scrape out the cracks of the sidewalk and driveway, which is so abusive it even does a number on steel weed pullers. Instead, I save this one exclusively for dandelions and other tubulars that sprout in soil. And for that, it's been a fine tool. Nice shape, no hand cramps, good materials, just gotta be a little cautious with the tip.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Allen

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great for me. Very solidly made, nice and large, with a comfy handle. The curved shape makes a convenient fulcrum for popping out the weeds. I know that a few have complained that, because it's made of stiff aluminum rather than malleable steel, there's a chance that you might break off (rather than bend) one of the fork tines if you encounter a submerged rock or root while weeding. Indeed that MIGHT be an issue, but I still prefer the lightweight aluminum and it certainly looks and feels very strong in that area. I'll simply stop prying if it gets so hard that I think there might be a breakage possibility.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory T Reid

customer_reviews.title: YOU CAN USE ONE HANDED! Excellent weeder- we would not give this away!
customer_reviews.text: We like this better than another 'dandelion weeder' we also bought. *This Fiskars is so EASY to use! *Just like it's rival products, the wavy part of this is great for doing all the work. * Insert in the ground, close to the weed you want to remove, lay the wave part on the ground and push the handle downward. The weed comes up, along with the root! *The main reason I like this better, is it releases the weed easier, as the tool has a coating on it, like it has been sprayed with PAM. My other weeder does not release easily- you have to use opposite hand. *It is almost no hands needed.
customer_reviews.author: LMS

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to be "green" and manually de-dendelion my yard.  It didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Out of roughly 100 dandelions I pulled I got the whole root on about five of them. This would probably be great for loose soil, but for the yard, forget about it. Apparently if you don't pull the whole root the dandelion will coming back. I guess I'll have about 95 of them to deal with next year. I fully understand this is not intended to be used in a large area. I gave it five stars because for its intended use in a garden it would be very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Vonzo

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing and does not bend in heavy clay soil
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AWESOME! VERY heavy duty/sturdy and no give/bend at ALL when using it. I have heavy clay soil in my yard and this thing had no problem getting down into the soil and it pried the weeds out easily. My biggest worry was that it might bend as, these things always bend, but this one did not and is much, much heavier/thicker than any weeder I've ever seen before. I think it MIGHT bend if you stuck it under a large tree root and then stood on it ... and that's probably the only way you could get it to! Great product, VERY happy!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Tips broke off
customer_reviews.text: I usually just let my dandelions go, but this year I wanted to clean up my paver patio. I saw this thing in my garage and decided to use it after years of it hanging on the wall unused. The tips broke off. The metal this thing is made of is not strong enough to pry between paver bricks to get those really tough ones.
customer_reviews.author: leonard bartkus

customer_reviews.title: Must have for gardeners
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace one I used for years but misplaced. Very useful for tap root type weeds. Design allows leverage to pry. Usefulness depends on type of soil but I have hard, clay and stones soil and works much better than fork tip prong type. Got this to compare with Home Grown garden tools Handy Weeder which is $1.00 more. This has a different covering on the handle. The Handy Weeder has finger bumps and is smooth, the Fiskar has a sponge rubber grip w/o notches. Otherwise the two tools are, virtually, identical.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. L

customer_reviews.title: Weeder feared by weeds.
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a weeder similar to this & loved it. Unfortunately, I broke one of the tongs when trying to get up a weed situated between 2 cement slabs (my mistake). I looked for a while before finding this weeder. I am in love again. It gets into the ground close to the weed & is able to lift it out with the root. The angle helps seeing where you have to go into the ground. The handle is very comfortable. One solid piece below the handle makes it strong. One piece of advice - easier to get the entire weed with root up if the soil is wet (i.e.., after it rains). Highly recommend. I even bought 2.
customer_reviews.author: Gravedigger

customer_reviews.title: Makes pulling weeds so much easier
customer_reviews.text: I use this tool every time i need to pull one of those large nasty weeds that have been left to take over the yard. The handle is nice and large so fits my hand well and the way it is designed allows to really get down into the soil nice and deep. I have used this in hard dry dirt and it works much better than straight rod weeders. I am very pleased with this product and would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: jessie

customer_reviews.title: Great little Tool to Pop out Weeds
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy tool to have when you are in the mood to attack some dandelions! Lightweight with a comfortable grip. Simply stick the blade into the soil under the root and give a light tug. Somehow much more satisfying than weeding by hand...perhaps because your hands stay clean! Will rust if exposed to a night out in the rain, but i have found that to be the case of all the Fiskars garden tools I own. Keep your Fiskars dry!
customer_reviews.author: Time2Buy

customer_reviews.title: My Tool for Weeding Satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: I received my soft touch weeder today Sunday and went to my yard right away to try it. Awesome weeder. I was able to go deeper so very easily by pointing the forked ends sideways to the weed. I can't wait for the weeds to grow back so I will have the satisfaction of using this tool again and again. I have a small yard and just weeded it few days ago. However I did not get any satisfaction from that because the roots were mostly untouched. The weeder I used then was next to ineffective. I highly recommend this weeding tool especially if one finds weeding to be relaxing and rewarding and not laborious.
customer_reviews.author: Lovlee

customer_reviews.title: The Best Weeder
customer_reviews.text: I lost a similar weeder and my local big box retailers didn't carry this weeder so I turned to Amazon. The design of this weeder allows the user to "lift" the weed prior to the final pull. Straight designs can't hold a candle to this weeder.
customer_reviews.author: Pickup Guy

customer_reviews.title: Works Very Well!
customer_reviews.text: Works well in hard clay yards (Las Vegas)! I would imagine it works equally well on grass. It won’t help that much in driveway cracks, but other than that, it beats poisoning yourself with Round Up!
customer_reviews.author: beverly anne oconnor

customer_reviews.title: Solid Weeder
customer_reviews.text: I was torn on buying a weeder because I felt like it is something that I could/should be able to do myself. I found out, however, that many weeds extend deep into the ground and can be challenging to fully extricate from the soil. So, I bought this and it has definitely made it easier to take out some of the larger more robust weeds. My one note is that the tip of it probably should be slightly narrower to allow for easier digging in harder soil. It's a minor complaint, but something I found myself thinking time and time again. Anyway, this tool is a good value for the price, solid quality, and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam M.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for smaller jobs
customer_reviews.text: This little tool is a friend to your hands. Having ruined my joints from years of gardening without proper tools, this is a must. Not only does it really get the whole tap root out, and few things are as satisfying as that while gardening, it really saves your hands. Plus it saves the area around the extraction of said interloper with pointed ends for precision. No big holes all over the lawn or flower garden, like some of the pronged ones leave. Easy to store, easy to carry around the yard as you do other things, just in case an uninvited guests has taken up residency.
customer_reviews.author: parker

customer_reviews.title: I had a fantastic weeder that sadly snapped in the middle of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a fantastic weeder that sadly snapped in the middle of the metal (not this brand) which led me on a hunt to find the best new weeding tool. This is what I found and eventually purchased after looking at reviews. It is durable and easy to hold, but I much prefer a longer skinny part at the end so it can pierce the soil further than this tool allows. I ended up with a lot of snapped dandelion roots last summer during it’s use, whereas my old one would pull out the tap root beautifully. Sigh. I’m still on the hunt...
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Great for those with bad wrists!
customer_reviews.text: I have a weak wrist due to multiple injuries and have struggled with everyday tasks for years, including weeding. Now, I just pop weeds out like nothing else, and my wrist doesn't get sore. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect weed tool
customer_reviews.text: Someone figured out the perfect weed (esp. dandelions) tool. I have a poorly made tool with the fulcrum concept & it is the only style I have ever had that really works. This Fiskars tool is perfectly designed and I think it would take an idiot to break it. I am buying a second one before they screw it up.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Best Tool I’ve Found For Weeding
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for removing the most cemented weeds. Comfortable and produces great leverage. Only complaint is that had I’ve one break at the curved portion while leveraging out a large plant.
customer_reviews.author: Psychomiko

customer_reviews.title: lasted about 4 years before it snapped
customer_reviews.text: I regularly clear out dandelions in the late spring and summer, and it just snapped while maneuvering around some tree roots. Lasted about 4 years before breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Dan from the Gateway to the West

customer_reviews.title: Must Have!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tool for pulling dandelions and weeds. Used this for hours in the dandelion covered yard of my new house when I was recovering from bladder surgery. I couldn't work, but I could sit in my yard and pull dandelions and found it very therapeutic. My pectoral muscle was very sore after hours of use, so be prepared if you just can't stop pulling weeds. Much easier to use after a rain or adding water to the soil around the root of weeds first.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Great weeder! Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Best weeder I've ever had. This is a replacement for one I'd had for years and this beats it hands down! The handle is nice and long and the prongs are super sharp and look they will be easy to sharpen when they get dull. It's ergonomically shaped to make it easier to use and the prongs go right down into the ground under those roots like nobodies business! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lou Annette Holden

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: I love this weeder. my husband got this for me last February and we've been using it since spring and summer time. it works great and sturdy too. the handle on it has a soft grip. we pulled lost of dandelions and other weeds on it already. again all i can say it i really love it. i would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: clifford b. morris

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. First off, it never really worked well. Second, my 5 year old grandson was weeding with me, and the tip broke off. In the trash it went.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tap root unearther, despite its weird shape.
customer_reviews.text: Over a year later, this weeder is still my favorite dandelion thwarter. The bulbous shape looks like it shouldn't be able to sink into the earth easily, but it goes in with surprising ease. It's far sturdier than any weed pick I've had before; the only threat I can see is the possibility of rust later.
customer_reviews.author: SJ and SF

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a silly tool
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap, it's simple, it works. Looks like a silly tool, but it actually is pretty successful in helping pull out weeds from the ground. You will have to get on your knees to pull the weeds, so your back might hurt after awhile, but it is much cheaper than those ones that are tall. Plus no moving parts, so less likely to break!
customer_reviews.author: Marlene and Mark

customer_reviews.title: There has to be a better way....
customer_reviews.text: Normally I like everything fiskars but I find this tool useless. I am sure it is great for those that have great top soil, but i'm finding I can't get deep enough into the dirt to make it grab anything. Sorry not my fav tool.
customer_reviews.author: Layda

customer_reviews.title: Already a favorite!
customer_reviews.text: This is one sturdy, useful tool. It's strong enough that I can go "digging" deeply for those Bermuda grass roots! Great tool. Sturdier and better balanced than my other weeding tools. Fits nicely and is balanced even in my small hands. Has a lifetime warranty and doesn't appear to me I have to worry about it rusting at all. I recommend this tool without hesitation. Strong, sturdy, ergonomically designed. Worth whatever I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Babargreen

customer_reviews.title: I was greatly disappointed with this tool
customer_reviews.text: Though I am an faithful user of Fiskars products, I was greatly disappointed with this tool. The prongs are too thick and the points are too blunt and short to be effective. It's heavy. I've now given up and put it into the recycling bin. I would not recommend for purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BoBo

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: This is a really handy weeder tool. The handle is longer than it appears to be in the picture, so you can get weeds at the base of a plant easily. I used it as soon as it came in to get some weeds out of a ceramic planter that has a plant with sharp points and I was able to remove the weeds without getting jabbed even once, so I like this tool a lot. It got the entire weed and root out really easily when I tried it out.
customer_reviews.author: Talltexan

customer_reviews.title: My favorite weeding tool.
customer_reviews.text: Great for pulling weeds large and small. Easy to grab the root and remove the whole weed. I snapped my first one after two seasons. I think it was my fault because I was trying to remove flower bulbs that were too deep and in hard packed dirt. I immediately purchased this second one to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Shackelford

customer_reviews.title: exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality tool; also fairly inexpensive. I had used the straight versions of these tools, but the leverage from the curve makes an amazing difference. I'd say that I pull up weeds twice as fast with this than I did with the simple straight model (and my hands don't hurt from using them as leverage instead). The V is narrower than my straight tool; however, it doesn't seem to appreciably affect my ability to pull up weeds, no matter how big or small. The narrow tip (because of the narrower V) is easier to push into the ground though than my other tool.
customer_reviews.author: K. Werner

customer_reviews.title: High quality weeding tool
customer_reviews.text: The best toolb for weeding. Gets dandelions out like pulling carrots from sand. Easy with root and all. Love this tool. Easy to use and works. High quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hanan

customer_reviews.title: Not good for getting weeds amongst flowers and ground cover.
customer_reviews.text: Real simple: it's hard to get to weeds amongst other flowers. After using it for 15' I went back to the method that works: pulling the weeds by hand. I did not have any dandelions to use it on and I can see where it would work much better than pulling dandelions! It simply isn't what I need for my type of weeding. I might as well use the weeder with a V shaped head like this that I have on a long handle....much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Historken

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - works well - comfort handle relieves stress on your hand
customer_reviews.text: Great weeding tool - fits the hand nicely with a comfort grip. The design gives you a level point that allows easy prying up of weeds by just pushing the handle toward the ground once you have inserted the point under the weed base. I own several Fiskars products and they make quality tools.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty But Waiting To See How It Works
customer_reviews.text: This came in the winter, so I haven't used it yet. Have a cheaper one shaped similar to this. This is much more heavy duty so hoping it works the same. I gave it 4 stars based on how much I like the one I have, hoping this one works just as well. Come summer I'll find out. If it doesn't then I'll be really disappointed as this was much more expensive than the one I presently have.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great design for removing dandelions (including roots)
customer_reviews.text: This weeder has a slightly narrower v-groove then other similar weeding tools. I find that this narrower opening works great for removing dandelions and helps to ensure that the entire root is removed. We have another brand that has a larger opening and often it will only remove the top of the plant leaving the root in place. We are very happy with this design.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous80

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and ergonomic. Gets the roots. You figure out the method and with a twist pop those weeds right out.
customer_reviews.author: John Firestone

customer_reviews.title: Strong and very useful weeder
customer_reviews.text: I am starting to accumulate Fiskars products! They are all of great quality. This one is pretty strong and is very helpful to dig out weeds. Not all weeds come out with entire roots, but that's not the problem of the weeder itself. I have a rocky clay soil and it's hard to pull out weeds. This weeder helps me to dig out weeds with minimal damage to the lawn. And, I think it will last a pretty long time in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Siva

customer_reviews.title: they suck to pull by hand because they are stubborn and ...
customer_reviews.text: My backyard gets riddled with weeds that have thick roots, they suck to pull by hand because they are stubborn and don't want to come out of the ground. This is a big helper and really does make a difference when it comes to pulling out the big weeds, smaller weeds it doesn't really have any effect on so I wouldn't suggest getting this if you only have small weeds in your yard.
customer_reviews.author: Belle S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have never used such a gizmo before, but since I have tons of weeding work in my yard each season I decided to buy it after reading positive reviews. It was a good decision. The item is very comfortable to handle, does a good job pushing all different weeds out, the smart design of the "blade" gives you a good leverage when needed. Not heavy, looks sturdy. I like it very much. Watch out the "fork" is very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Does quick and easy work on dandelions and other deep-rooted weeds
customer_reviews.text: It's been a couple of months now, and this tool really comes in handy. My yard has been dandelion-free for weeks because they are so easy to pop out of the ground with this thing. And the weeder still looks brand new. No chips, bends, or rust. I'm happy to have this in the shed.
customer_reviews.author: A. Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Does not work at all. They wont even allow any refunds. Save Your Money.
customer_reviews.author: David Son

customer_reviews.title: love fiskar products, excellent quality for this price.
customer_reviews.text: I never thought much of Fiskars in the past, but recently have purchased some mini bonsai scissors, and then a more rugged pruning scissors, and now this tool. All are excellent build quality. which is something that is seriously lacking in products these days. Can easily say they are the best tools at this price point available. Quality you would think would cost double what these do.
customer_reviews.author: Design2Connect

customer_reviews.title: Excellent weeder
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of the best weeders on the market. It's got leverage, something that a regular fork weeder doesn't have. It loosens the soil nice and deep and makes it easy to pull out deep-rooted weed. A must-have
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: does not rust. Good leverage
customer_reviews.text: I have left this out in the rail accicently after working late into night and found next day wet but no rest. This tool has a strong curve and long lever arm so once you get a hold weed root your push down and the middle of the curve contacts the top of the soil while the teeth pull the root up. Basically this means you don't have to dig a wide hole to get the entire root. This reduces the amount of good grass and good seeds from being pulled. Also nice wide teeth to get big roots. Good soft handle.
customer_reviews.author: James, Louisville KY

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Love this little weeder, durable and doesnt feel like it will bend. Really works to get those hard to get weeds.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Waters

customer_reviews.title: Really Useful!
customer_reviews.text: This weeder does help loosen the roots of deep rooted weeds. You would think that its weirdly shaped, but that design actually makes them slide through the soil very easily. It is important to get rid off the weeds totally by making sure that it is pulled out all the way from the roots. I would have never been able to do that with some of the strong rooted weeds I had in the backyard last summer. Now there are gone forever. I recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: YDR05

customer_reviews.title: One of the BEST weed remover tools that I ever have
customer_reviews.text: One of the BEST weed remover tools that I ever have! There are so many weeds and wildflowers growing in my stamp size Japanese garden. It is so handy to have it to remove the weeds. I do not know if it is the design or it is the leverage handle that makes my life so easy. It really helps to elevate my carpal tunnel symptoms.​
customer_reviews.author: Guqin Fan

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, nice leverage, comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: I got this on gold box or lightning deal and after receiving it I would happily have paid full price. It's very quality and heavy duty. I hand pull most weeds but working close to flowers or for resistant weeds this is helpful and gives good leverage. I have a few other fiskars brand small hand garden tools and they're all good and durable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Vallynn

customer_reviews.title: Winning the Weed War - another Asset
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the 'must have' tools recommended in one of my gardening sources - the wide part aids in getting a larger scope or scoop of weeds. I still use my traditional weed tools - but this won is a winner to add to the garden apparatus -
customer_reviews.author: Victoria M. Wall

customer_reviews.title: Somebody really thought this one out
customer_reviews.text: This one’s a winner. The design is actually functional not just a design exercise! We love it.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Starkey

customer_reviews.title: Really works well.
customer_reviews.text: My mom strongly dislikes weeds in her yard or garden and has used a screwdriver to loosen the roots for years. This works a lot better and easier. It pulls the whole weed, roots and all, so it doesn't just grow right back. It is a lot easier on her back as well and doesn't get as sore from yard work.
customer_reviews.author: Karenw

customer_reviews.title: Hand we Eder is the BEST!
customer_reviews.text: Love this for getting weeds out of your lawn or garden. Can’t believe it took me so long to find this product to make digging weeds so EASY!! Best product ever!!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn F

customer_reviews.title: Easy Pop Up Weeder
customer_reviews.text: I love this easy to use weeder that helps pop the weed up out of the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis A. Widman

customer_reviews.title: and this weeder is so easy and comfortable to hold -- and works beautifully in ...
customer_reviews.text: I am 63 years old, and this weeder is so easy and comfortable to hold -- and works beautifully in my hard clay soil. Many years ago I visited the original Fiskars company outside of Helsinki, Finland, and it is clear from their history that they have always been devoted to manufacturing high-quality products. I am a loyal Fiskars fan.
customer_reviews.author: ABQ

customer_reviews.title: You Won't Be Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is a best buy in the gardening tool category. I found this after hunting unsuccessfully locally for the same old cheap type dandelion picker that eventually breaks and gives me a blister when using it. The design is ingenious, it seems very sturdy and it is ergonomic. Says it's made of aluminum, but it feels like stainless steel. It works, it's cheap and has a lifetime warranty - what's not to like?!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I simply love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of three new hand tools that I purchased this year. I spend a lot of time in the garden and a lot of time weeding, and I decided to give this a try. It was the cheapest of the three tools that I added to my collection, and I simply love it. It does what it says it will do, and makes short work of deeply rooted weeds. The leverage is the key.
customer_reviews.author: Lida Rose

customer_reviews.title: weeder
customer_reviews.text: like the way the curve adds in prying out the weeds
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B. Carey

customer_reviews.title: Very useful tool, unless your yard has a million dandelions like mine.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool. I was trying to rid my yard of dandelions the old fashion way but when I realized that for every one I got rid of another 20 were growing next to it, I just bought chemicals instead. This tool will definitely be handy for whatever remaining dandelions I might find.
customer_reviews.author: Barry H.

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good idea
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY like this tool! I am using it for digging around some truly stubborn weeds in my raised beds, as well as loosening soil around the last of the plants there. The price & shipping were good, & I can use this without much additional pain in my arthritic old hands. Now we'll see about the tools' longevity....
customer_reviews.author: C T M

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sturdy tool.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not quite sure how this thing is so sturdy, but it is. I've pried out some of the largest weeds in rock hard soil just to test it out and it just won't fail. It doesn't always work great for certain types of roots but it will pry out anything that is possible to be pried out.
customer_reviews.author: Josef

customer_reviews.title: sturdy
customer_reviews.text: great tool for the hard ground here in New Mexico
customer_reviews.author: Claudiaintaos

customer_reviews.title: Don;t buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This broke within the first 10minutes of use in soft wet soil.
customer_reviews.author: thoughts

customer_reviews.title: Great for pulling weeds
customer_reviews.text: This works great for pulling weeks. I use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Glaser

customer_reviews.title: it's really more of a maintenance tool for someone that takes better care of their garden than I do
customer_reviews.text: It's ok if you don't have a ton of weeds in the garden, it's really more of a maintenance tool for someone that takes better care of their garden than I do. It is well made as per the Fiskars brand and does the trick, just requires a little more elbow grease than I really want to put out for the gnarly weeds here in the deep south.
customer_reviews.author: Swamplilli

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Soft handle, long enough to get some good leverage, sinks into the earth easily, and dislodges unwanted plant pests! The tines shouldn't be wider, the objective is to interrupt the growth, not to cut it! Lifts out trailers etc so you can find the source...& eliminate! One piece Aluminum so I expect it to be around awhile--quite pleased! Good call guys! ☑️
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Makes pulling weeds easier, for sure. Not advisable to use with small rocks. If you have to, get the rocks out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars Softouch Weeder
customer_reviews.text: Quality garden tool. Soft touch handle is quite comfortable. The curve in the blade gives unique angle and leverage options to enable getting at the heart of stubborn root systems. Solid construction. I will be looking at other Fiskars garden tools to replace worn tools in my gardening arsenal. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JinglepawsTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Big help for a chore that isn't enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: This simple tool makes weeding so much easier and since it is padded, it makes it almost enjoyable. And, the best part, no blisters from holding a tool to weed with. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Midge

customer_reviews.title: works fine
customer_reviews.text: once i got the hang of it, it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars Softouch Weeder
customer_reviews.text: A Fiskars companion Weeder tool to the 3 Piece Softouch Garden Tool Set (7067). Again, ultra high quality that should allow this tool to last for a decade or more if cleaned after use. Softtouch handles allow persons with hand grip/joint issues an easier tool to work with. In future I'll order one for myself. Thank you. Amazon price can't be bettered at time of purchase !
customer_reviews.author: Paul A.

customer_reviews.title: Slayer for the ages
customer_reviews.text: I use to beat the crap out of my k bar knife slaying some weeds, but now the only epic weed slayer I need is right her. My ranking is now 46-3 with this little bad boy, not to many contenders I haven't taken down. Recomendeth is epic for this beastly one handed.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: My hand works better for pulling the weeds than this tool. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: MandaBK

customer_reviews.title: makes weeding fun!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item because we have lots of dandylion weeds both in the flower beds and in the grass. This tool works great! It was easy to dig under the plant, push down and pop the weed and a good amount of the roots up in one step. In the grass it was great because it doesn't make a huge hole, so once the weed is out, you don't even see where there was one. Anyhow, very happy buyer - thinking of purchasing one for my Mom who likes to garden!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Less damaging than a flamethrower
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good for pulling out weeds. Best tool I've used for this, but still wish there was something better. I used to work at a ski resort where we use huge flame throwers to melt snow guns. I've thought about using something like those flame throwers on my lawns at times. I could live with the grass being a casualty of my war with weeds.
customer_reviews.author: randomdude1978

customer_reviews.title: Modern twist on a traditional weed puller
customer_reviews.text: Modern twist on a traditional weed puller. It does pretty much exactly what you'd expect. It does it well. And the hand grip is extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: xs

customer_reviews.title: USELESS
customer_reviews.text: A totally useless product! Seriously, nothing actually happened when I tried uprooting a weed. I went back to my plain 20 year old model.
customer_reviews.author: belle mere

customer_reviews.title: There ain't enough room in this town for both of us, weed!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Sunday gardener in the family and wasn't sure he'd get any use out of this, but he was thrilled when he unwrapped this gift and I told him what it was for. Weeds are a pain and this little guy gets right down to the roots so that they don't grow back as quickly. Handy. Kindly priced. Thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: A Got-to-have-it tool
customer_reviews.text: Awesome weeding tool. This is my third one I've purchased...not because the other two broke, but because I keep giving them as gifts. Easy on the hands, and the push out part (don't know what else to call it) gives good leverage for those big dandelion with roots to China.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Hartvig-Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: It does the trick removing crabgrass
customer_reviews.text: It does the trick removing crabgrass. Used on off and will use I. My new garden beds.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Swartz

customer_reviews.title: This works well. The only issue with the design ...
customer_reviews.text: This works well. The only issue with the design is that it could stand to have a slightly bigger arc in the middle, so that you don't have to rotate so far to use it as a lever arm against the ground. I usually walk around with a scrap of 2 x 4 and just place it just behind the tool.
customer_reviews.author: T. Basic

customer_reviews.title: Another great product by Fiskars
customer_reviews.text: The Fiskars Softouch Weeder makes digging up small weeds in my lawn much easier. Using other type weeders of this nature I would regularly get blisters on my hands or fingers, using this tool I don't have that problem and because of its design it's also easier to dig up the weeds.
customer_reviews.author: LN

customer_reviews.title: It's SO much better than the one I bought from a hardware store
customer_reviews.text: When my son got a puppy, he told me I needed to remove the mushrooms growing in my yard, I was able to use the Softtouch Weeder to dig up the roots as well. It's SO much better than the one I bought from a hardware store. My hand joints are tender and this weeder makes all the digging in my garden easier for me
customer_reviews.author: maple

customer_reviews.title: feels heavy and high quality
customer_reviews.text: Really heavy duty and seems like it will last a long time, but Murphy's law is all my weeds are coming up super easy with just pulling now that I've bought this thing, so I haven't really put it to task yet.
customer_reviews.author: DJZ

customer_reviews.title: Great for pulling most weeds!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for pulling out most weeds. There are some weeds that the roots just go too deep and all over the place, so this doesn't get a good hold on them. I would recommend buying this. If it ever breaks, I'll buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: sarahe26

customer_reviews.title: Might not work for your purposes, but for the price it is worth a try.
customer_reviews.text: This works but not much better than a spade for the most part. If you have soft grass there will be little use for it, but it does work well for larger plantains and the like. Still for the price it is definitely worth a try to see if it works for your purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Lazlo Hollyfeld

customer_reviews.title: Quick and efficient way to get out dandelions
customer_reviews.text: Works great when the ground is damp. Push the fork down close to two inches deep and set back about one inch from the dandelion base, press the handle down while gently pulling up on the leaves. Most of the root will come right out with the plant. More efficient than weed & feed or 2-4D.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke 1st use
customer_reviews.text: Cheap piece of ... Made in China. One of the teeth broke right off during 1st use. Can't believe Fiskars even has their name on this product. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Toby Buhr

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy product, nice design.  Needs a tweak
customer_reviews.text: I love the beautiful, cast aluminum design and elegant curves and good hand grip. One big flaw, however, as mentioned in other reviews: The fork is too small. Makes it very difficult to find the root of the weed especially in dense grass where the center of the weed is not exactly clear. Still does the job. Often takes several stabs.
customer_reviews.author: EBL

customer_reviews.title: i used to have a fork/weeder that worked much better
customer_reviews.text: Can't find the kind I used to have. The fork was deeper and you could get really deep in the soil and pull out the weed, root and all. This product is okay but I never reach for it because it really doesn't do the job. One reason i bought it was that it has a life time quarantee being a fiskar product but......................it wont wear out, i never use it.
customer_reviews.author: Lake Dweller

customer_reviews.title: Love this tool
customer_reviews.text: Makes getting those tougher weeds out with roots intact a much easier job. Love this tool!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Scott

customer_reviews.title: If you have weeks, you need this.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one, I seem to misplace either at any given time and I always have weeding to do. They effortlessly lift large weeds, root and all, without taking much soil with it so that the spot is quickly covered and recovers.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Dandelions in My Yard
customer_reviews.text: I used this in the spring time to pull all of the dandelions in my yard. Its now September and it has been sitting on my shelf in the shed for months. (That's a good thing). Makes pulling dandelions an easy task. Do it quickly and easily and get the root so they wont come back. Enjoy your yard.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: Great for Weeding Cactus Plants
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for reaching into and leveraging out those occasional pesky weeds that insist on growing in my cactus plants. Keeps you safe from the cactus needles for the most part. It would be nice if they made another model that was about one foot longer in length. That would be the ultimate as far as I am concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: It's Fiskars, so I'm sure it's good.  So far, I'm so antsy when I see weeds, I yank 'em out by hand.
customer_reviews.text: It's Fiskars, so I know it's good. Haven't used it yet. I keep grabbing the weeds out by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen E. Little

product_meta.title: Fiskars Softouch Hand Weeder, 70606935J
product_meta.description: Item Package Quantity:1Fiskars ultra-durable Weeder makes it easy to remove weeds and their roots. A large, soft grip reduces hand and wrist fatigue while you weed, and a cast-aluminum head resists rust and won’t snap off while you’re weeding, no matter how tough your soil is. Additionally, the handle includes a hang hole for convenient storage.
feature_bullets: Ideal for removing dandelions, thistles and other invasive weeds
Extra-large, ergonomically designed handle with Softgrip improves control while reducing hand and wrist fatigue
Curved head with forked tines provides plenty of leverage to easily pull the entire root free
Cast-aluminum head resists rust for lasting value

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars877 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
